Stem: Silvery-green, smooth and sometimes slightly ribbed when young.
Leaves: Oval to oblong shape, glossy green on top, pale green or yellow-brown underneath. Opposite on stem, 6-10 cm long.
Flowers: Small, cream or white with 4 petals, in clusters of many on branches.
FruitSeeds: Round with a sharp tip at base, 15-30 mm diameter. Green with white spots when young, turning purplish-black as they ripen. Containing one brown oblong seed.
Habitat: Gullies, urban bushland, roadsides, waste areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Very similar to European olive (*Olea europaea subsp. europaea*) but with smaller, less fleshy fruit.
